meanings.definition: Relating to or involving new words or new meanings of existing words.
meanings.sent1: The neological concept was difficult to understand at first.
meanings.sent2: Her neological approach to language fascinated linguists.
meanings.sent3: The neological twist in the story made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His neological style of writing was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The neological idea sparked a wave of creativity in the class.

meanings.sent1: The neological phrases in the poem added depth to the meaning.
meanings.sent2: Their neological language reflected a modern perspective.
meanings.sent3: The neological joke at the party had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: In her neological way of speaking, she painted vivid pictures with words.
